definitions: the state of abstaining from sexual activity, especially for moral or religious reasons
examples: Medieval knights took vows of chastity before their crusades
The monastery required lifelong chastity from all its members

definitions: a friendly, informal conversation between two or more people
real-time electronic communication between people using text messages
examples: They enjoyed a pleasant chat over afternoon tea
The neighbors stopped for a quick chat about the weather
The customer service chat helped resolve her issue immediately
Their daily video chat kept the long-distance relationship strong

definitions: a large French country house or castle, often of architectural significance
a vineyard estate in France where wine is produced and stored
examples: The Loire Valley contains numerous magnificent chateaux from the Renaissance
They toured the medieval chateau with its impressive moat
The prestigious Bordeaux chateau produces exceptional vintage wines
Wine connoisseurs visited the chateau for exclusive tastings

definitions: continuous rapid informal talk about unimportant matters
rapid clicking sound made by teeth when cold or frightened
series of short, quick sounds made by animals or machines
examples: The constant chatter in the cafeteria made studying impossible
Children's excited chatter filled the playground during recess
Her teeth began their uncontrollable chatter in the freezing wind
The dentist noticed his nervous chatter before the procedure
The monkey's chatter warned the group of approaching danger
Machine gun chatter echoed through the battlefield

definitions: the act of talking rapidly and continuously about trivial matters
involuntary rapid movement of teeth producing clicking sounds
examples: The chattering of students stopped when the teacher entered
Her nervous chattering revealed her anxiety about the interview
The chattering of his teeth was audible despite the blanket
Hypothermia causes uncontrollable chattering of the jaw muscles

definitions: a person employed to drive a private car for someone else
examples: The executive's chauffeur waited outside during the meeting
Their chauffeur knew all the best routes through the city

definitions: exaggerated or aggressive patriotism with belief in national superiority
prejudiced belief in male superiority and dominance over women
examples: His chauvinism prevented him from seeing his country's faults
National chauvinism led to dangerous foreign policy decisions
Workplace chauvinism created a hostile environment for female employees
The movement fought against centuries of institutional chauvinism

definitions: a person who acts dishonestly to gain an advantage
an act of cheating or fraudulent behavior
examples: The casino banned the cheat from all their properties
Nobody wanted to play cards with a known cheat
Using a calculator was considered a cheat during the mental math competition
The tax cheat cost the government millions in revenue

definitions: a person who acts dishonestly or unfairly to gain advantage
examples: The cheater was expelled from school after the scandal
Online gaming platforms use software to detect cheaters

definitions: acting dishonestly or unfairly to gain an advantage in games, exams, or situations
being sexually or romantically unfaithful to one's partner
examples: Cheating on the final exam resulted in immediate expulsion
The referee caught them cheating during the championship match
Their marriage ended after years of cheating and lies
Emotional cheating can be as damaging as physical infidelity

definitions: a careful examination or inspection to verify something
a written order directing a bank to pay money from an account
a pattern of squares in alternating colors
something that restrains or stops progress or action
examples: The security check at the airport took thirty minutes
Regular health checks can prevent serious illnesses
She wrote a check for the monthly rent payment
The check bounced due to insufficient funds
His shirt had a blue and white check pattern
The tablecloth featured a classic gingham check
The new regulations serve as a check on corporate power
Constitutional checks and balances prevent government overreach

definitions: a flat round piece used in the game of checkers
a person who examines or verifies something for accuracy
one square in a checkered pattern
examples: Move your checker diagonally to capture the opponent's piece
The red checker reached the opposite end and became a king
The fact checker verified all statements before publication
The quality checker inspected each product before shipping
Each checker in the pattern measured exactly one inch
The floor's black and white checkers created an optical illusion

definitions: a square board divided into sixty-four alternating colored squares for playing checkers or chess
examples: The antique checkerboard was made from marble and onyx
They set up the checkerboard for their weekly game night

definitions: a list of items to be checked or completed, typically in sequential order
examples: The pilot reviewed the pre-flight checklist before takeoff
She created a detailed checklist for the wedding preparations

definitions: a position in chess where the king is directly threatened and cannot escape capture
a situation of complete defeat with no possible escape or solution
examples: The grandmaster achieved checkmate in just fifteen moves
She studied various checkmate patterns to improve her endgame
The prosecutor's evidence created a legal checkmate for the defense
Their business rival's strategy resulted in a financial checkmate

definitions: the process or place where customers pay for goods in a store
the time by which guests must leave a hotel room
examples: The checkout line stretched all the way to the produce section
Self-service checkout has reduced waiting times significantly
Hotel checkout is at eleven o'clock sharp tomorrow morning
Late checkout costs an additional fifty dollars

definitions: a place where people, vehicles, or goods are inspected or controlled, typically for security
examples: Soldiers examined documents at the military checkpoint
The border checkpoint processed thousands of travelers daily

definitions: a firm smooth yellow or white cheese originally made in Cheddar, England
examples: Sharp cheddar adds intense flavor to the sandwich
The recipe calls for two cups of grated cheddar

definitions: the fleshy part of either side of the face below the eye
informal term for either half of the buttocks
audacious or impudent behavior showing lack of respect
examples: Her cheeks flushed bright red with embarrassment
The baby's chubby cheeks made everyone smile
The injection went into the upper outer cheek area
The toddler received a gentle pat on the cheek
His cheek in speaking to the principal shocked everyone
Such cheek deserves a stern reprimand

definitions: the bone that forms the prominent part of the cheek below the eye socket
examples: High cheekbones are considered attractive in many cultures
The blow fractured his left cheekbone during the match

definitions: a loud shout of joy, approval, or encouragement
a feeling of happiness or optimistic mood
examples: The crowd erupted in cheers when the team scored
Three cheers for the birthday girl rang through the room
The holiday decorations brought cheer to the hospital ward
Her visit spread cheer among the nursing home residents

definitions: the act of shouting encouragement or approval, especially at sports events
examples: The cheering from the stands motivated the losing team
Constant cheering made her voice hoarse by halftime

definitions: a person who leads organized cheering at sports events
someone who enthusiastically supports or promotes a cause or person
examples: The cheerleaders performed elaborate routines during halftime
She was captain of the varsity cheerleader squad
The CEO acted as chief cheerleader for the merger
He became an enthusiastic cheerleader for renewable energy

definitions: a food made from pressed milk curds, varying in texture and flavor
examples: The platter featured five different types of cheese
Melted cheese topped the delicious pizza perfectly

definitions: a hamburger topped with a slice of cheese, typically served in a bun
examples: He ordered a double cheeseburger with extra pickles
The restaurant's signature cheeseburger uses three types of cheese

definitions: a rich sweet dessert made with cream cheese, eggs, and sugar on a crust
informal photography featuring attractive women in provocative poses
examples: New York style cheesecake is famous for its density
She baked a strawberry cheesecake for the celebration
The vintage calendar featured classic cheesecake photography
Pin-up cheesecake posters decorated the garage walls

definitions: a large spotted cat native to Africa, the fastest land animal
examples: The cheetah can reach speeds of seventy miles per hour
Conservation efforts have helped protect endangered cheetah populations

definitions: a professional cook who manages a kitchen, especially in a restaurant or hotel
examples: The executive chef created an innovative tasting menu
She trained under famous chefs in Paris before opening her restaurant

definitions: a distinct compound or substance produced by or used in chemical processes
examples: Dangerous chemicals require proper storage and handling procedures
The laboratory tests identified several toxic chemicals in the water

definitions: a scientist who specializes in chemistry and chemical research
British term for a person who prepares and sells medicines in a pharmacy
examples: The chemist discovered a new polymer with unique properties
Several chemists won the Nobel Prize for their groundbreaking research
Ask the chemist about potential drug interactions
The local chemist stays open late on weekdays

definitions: the branch of science studying the properties, composition, and behavior of matter
the complex emotional or psychological interaction between people
examples: She majored in chemistry with a focus on organic compounds
Modern chemistry has revolutionized medicine and materials science
The romantic chemistry between them was obvious to everyone
Team chemistry is crucial for winning championships

definitions: medical treatment using powerful chemicals to destroy cancer cells in the body
examples: The oncologist recommended six rounds of chemotherapy
Side effects from chemotherapy can be managed with supportive care

definitions: British spelling of check; a written order directing a bank to pay money
examples: She wrote a cheque for the monthly rent payment
The cheque cleared after three business days

definitions: a small round red or black fruit with a stone inside
the tree that produces cherry fruit, valued for wood and blossoms
slang term for virginity or virgin status
examples: Fresh cherries are perfect for making pie
The bowl overflowed with sweet dark cherries
Cherry trees bloom spectacularly in spring
The furniture was crafted from solid cherry wood
Losing one's cherry is a coming-of-age milestone
The phrase 'popping the cherry' refers to first experiences

definitions: a winged angelic being described in religious texts, often depicted as a child
an innocent or sweet-looking child with a round, chubby face
examples: Renaissance paintings often featured cherubs surrounding religious figures
Golden cherubs decorated the cathedral's elaborate ceiling
The sleeping toddler looked like a little cherub
Her cherub face masked a mischievous personality

definitions: a square board with sixty-four alternating light and dark squares for playing chess
examples: The handcrafted chessboard was made from ebony and maple
Each square on the chessboard has specific coordinates

definitions: any of the thirty-two pieces used in playing chess
examples: Each chessman moves according to specific rules
The carved ivory chessmen were museum-quality artifacts

definitions: the front part of the torso between neck and abdomen
a large strong box used for storage or transport
a fund or collection of money for a specific purpose
examples: His chest rose and fell with each deep breath
The X-ray revealed congestion in her chest
The antique chest contained family heirlooms
Pirates supposedly buried treasure chests on islands
The community chest funded local charity programs
The war chest grew as campaign donations increased

definitions: an edible brown nut that grows in a prickly case
the large tree that produces chestnuts
a deep reddish-brown color
an old joke or story that has been repeated too often
examples: Roasted chestnuts are a popular winter street food
The recipe requires peeled and chopped chestnuts
The ancient chestnut tree provided shade for generations
American chestnut trees were devastated by blight
Her hair was a beautiful chestnut color
The horse's chestnut coat gleamed in sunlight
He told the same old chestnuts at every gathering
That joke is such a chestnut nobody laughs anymore

definitions: a V-shaped line or stripe, especially used in heraldry or decoration
a badge of V-shaped stripes worn on military or police uniforms indicating rank
examples: The chevron pattern on the floor created an optical illusion
Decorative chevrons adorned the ancient shield
The sergeant wore three chevrons on each sleeve
Police chevrons indicate years of service and rank

definitions: an act or period of chewing something
a portion of tobacco for chewing
examples: Give the meat a good chew before swallowing
The tough steak required a long chew
He took a chew of tobacco during the baseball game
Smokeless chew still contains harmful nicotine

definitions: the action of crushing or grinding food with teeth
examples: Proper chewing aids digestion and nutrient absorption
The sound of chewing gum annoyed everyone in class

definitions: the twenty-second letter of the Greek alphabet
vital life force or energy in Chinese philosophy and medicine
examples: The chi symbol is used in statistics and mathematics
Chi-square tests help analyze categorical data
Tai chi movements help balance your body's chi
Acupuncture aims to restore the flow of chi

definitions: elegantly and stylishly fashionable quality or appearance
examples: Her effortless chic made her a fashion icon
Parisian chic influenced designers worldwide

definitions: a young bird, especially a newly hatched chicken
informal term for a young woman, sometimes considered offensive
examples: The mother hen protected her chicks from predators
Fluffy yellow chicks pecked at scattered grain
The beach was full of surfer chicks
That chick from accounting joined our team

definitions: a domesticated fowl kept for eggs and meat
the meat of a chicken prepared as food
informal term for a person who lacks courage
a game testing courage where participants dare each other
examples: The chicken scratched for worms in the yard
Free-range chickens produce better quality eggs
Grilled chicken makes a healthy protein choice
The restaurant serves excellent fried chicken
Don't be such a chicken about the roller coaster
He's too chicken to ask her out
They played chicken with their cars on the highway
Political chicken endangers international relations

definitions: a highly contagious viral disease causing itchy blisters, mainly affecting children
examples: Most children recover from chickenpox without complications
The chickenpox vaccine has dramatically reduced infection rates

definitions: a round yellowish seed used as food, also called garbanzo bean
examples: Hummus is made primarily from ground chickpeas
Roasted chickpeas make a healthy crunchy snack

definitions: a blue-flowered plant whose leaves are used in salads and roots as coffee substitute
examples: Chicory adds a slightly bitter flavor to salads
New Orleans coffee often contains roasted chicory root

definitions: a leader or ruler of a people or clan
the person with the highest rank in an organization
examples: The tribal chief made decisions for the entire community
Native American chiefs signed historic treaties
The fire chief coordinated the emergency response
She was appointed chief of pediatric surgery
